description: Numerators of coefficients for numerical integration.
comments: a(n) is (-1)^n times the numerator of the "reverse" multiple zeta value zeta_n^R(0,0,...,0) for n>0. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Nov 29 2006a(n) = A191578(2*n,n)/(2*n)!, n>0. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Feb 02 2013
references: E. Isaacson and H. B. Keller, Analysis of Numerical Methods, ISBN 0 471 42865 5, 1966, John Wiley and Sons, pp. 318-319.
Charles Jordan, Calculus of Finite Differences, Chelsea 1965, p. 529.
A. N. Lowan and H. Salzer, Table of coefficients in numerical integration formulae, J. Math. Phys. Mass. Inst. Tech. 22 (1943), 49-50.
N. E. Nørlund, Vorlesungen über Differenzenrechnung, Springer-Verlag, Berlin, 1924.
N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
S. Akiyama and Y. Tanigawa, Multiple zeta values at non-positive integers, Ramanujan J. 5 (2001), 327-351.
D. Kruchinin and V. Kruchinin, A Generating Function for the Diagonal T2n,n in Triangles, Journal of Integer Sequence, Vol. 18 (2015), article 15.4.6.
Guodong Liu, Some computational formulas for Norlund numbers, Fib. Quart., 45 (2007), 133-137.
A. N. Lowan and H. Salzer, Table of coefficients in numerical integration formulae, J. Math. Phys. Mass. Inst. Tech. 22 (1943), 49-50.[Annotated scanned copy]
Index entries for sequences related to Bernoulli numbers.
formula: G.f.: -x/((1-x)*log(1-x)).Let K_i = A002208(i)/A002209(i), with K_1=1/2; K_2=-5/12; ... and [i n] = Stirling numbers of the first kind (e.g., [4 2] = 11), {i n} = Stirling numbers of the second kind (e.g., {4 2}=7) and B_i the Bernoulli numbers. Then K_i =((-1)^i / (i-1)! )*Sum_{n=1..i} [i n]*B_n/n and B_i = i*(-1)^i*Sum_{n=1..i} {i n}*(n-1)!*K_n. - Rudi Huysmans, rudi_huysmans(AT)hotmail.coma(n) = numerator((-1)^n*sum(k=0..n, (k!*stirling2(n,k)* stirling1(n+k,n))/(n+k)!)). - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Feb 02 2013a(n) = numerator(v(n)), where v(n)=1-sum(i=0..n-1,v(i)/(n-i+1)), v(0)=1. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Aug 28 2013a(n) = numerator(1/(n-1)!*Sum_{k=0..n} ((-1)^(n-k)*binomial(2*n,n-k)* stirling2(n+k,k))/(n+k)), n>0, a(0)=1. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Apr 05 2016
mathematica: Numerator/@CoefficientList[Series[-x/((1-x)Log[1-x]),{x,0,20}],x] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 04 2011 *)a[0] = 1; a[n_] := (-1)^n*Sum[(-1)^(k+1)*BernoulliB[k]*StirlingS1[n, k]/k, {k, 1, n}]/(n-1)!; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 20}] // Numerator (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 27 2012, after Rudi Huysmans's formula *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
